noun.description: A short smoothbore gun for firing shells (technically called bombs) at high angles.
A cup-shaped receptacle made of hard material, in which ingredients are crushed or ground, used especially in cooking or pharmacy.

verb.description: Attack or bombard with shells fired from a mortar.

origin: Middle English: from Old French mortier, from Latin mortarium, probably a transferred sense of the word denoting a container (see mortar).
